title: 2001 Sterling Acterra Dump Truck
item_description:
2001 Sterling Acterra Dump Truck

Specifications

  • Year: 2001
  • Make: Sterling
  • Model: Acterra
  • VIN: 2FZHANAK61AJ37143
  • License: N/A **
    • The plate was Removed by the Seller, Buyer will need to apply for new plates 
    • Registration Expiration: Exempt (prior use as a city-owned vehicle). 
  • Odometer Reads: 34,427 (verified on preview day)
  • Key: Available
  • GVWR: 52,000 Lbs
  • Drive Type: Rear Wheel Drive
  • Engine: Caterpillar 3126 7.2 Liter
  • Body Style: Dump Truck
  • Fuel Type: Diesel
  • Transmission: Automatic
  • Tire Size: 295/75R22.5
  • Deck Length: 156”
  • Deck Width: 84”
  • Wall Height: 42”

Exterior

  • Exterior Color: Orange
  • Doors: Two Door

Interior

  • Interior Material: Vinyl
  • Interior Color: Gray
  • Features:
    • Cruise Control
    • Steering Wheel Controls
    • Air Conditioning
    • Bed Mounted Toolboxes
    • Dual Rear Wheels

Note: Title or Application for Replacement Title and (REG 262) Transfer Form, will be mailed within 2 weeks after removal. The Bidder shall not bid on behalf of another individual; the Bidder/Purchaser/DMV Registrant must be the same. The Buyer is fully responsible for all aspects of registration, inspections, transfer, taxes, application of new license plates, and fees due to the DMV. **This vehicle is a city-owned vehicle and is exempt from registration. However, once the new buyer completes the transfer of title, the registration will no longer be exempt. 

CARB Truck and Bus Regulation Statement: “An on-road heavy-duty diesel or alternative-diesel vehicle operated in California may be subject to the California Air Resources Board Regulation to Reduce Particulate Matter and Criteria Pollutant Emissions from In-Use Heavy-Duty Diesel Vehicles. It, therefore, could be subject to exhaust retrofit or accelerated turnover requirements to reduce emissions of air pollutants.” For more information, please visit the California Air Resources Board website at http://www.arb.ca.gov/dieseltruck.”  This vehicle may be reported as a Non-Compliant Vehicle, you will not be able to register in California without meeting the CARB Truck and Bus Regulations. It is the buyer's responsibility to read and understand the ARB Multi-Regulation Summary Requirements for Diesel Truck Owners. Beginning January 1, 2020, the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) CANNOT register any vehicle that does not meet the requirements of the Truck and Bus Regulation.
